intro: Euphrasia nigra, commonly known as black eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, dark violet to blackish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Euphrasia nigra is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes other plants with similar floral structures.
